name: Smoky Chicken and Rice Soup
description: The smoked paprika used in this soup adds to its already high “comfort food” quality, smoky and satisfying. It’s also great with dumplings or small pasta added in place of the rice.
recipeIngredient: 2 tbsp (25 mL) olive oil2 chicken breasts, skinless and bone-in2 cups (500 mL) onion, coarsely chopped1 large red pepper, seeded and coarsely chopped1 large green pepper, seeded and coarsely chopped2 tbsp (25 mL) garlic, finely chopped1 tbsp (15 mL) smoked paprika (the sweet variety, not hot)3 plum tomatoes, diced6 cups (1.5 L) chicken stock¾ cup (175 mL) long-grain rice½ cup (125 mL) frozen peas2 cups (500 mL) baby spinachSalt and pepper to taste½ cup (125 mL) sour cream
recipeInstructions: In a large pot heat oil over medium-high heat, brown chicken breasts until golden. Set aside, the breasts will not be fully cooked at this point.2. In the same pot sauté onion for 5 minutes, add red peppers, green peppers, garlic and paprika. Cook for 3 minutes longer.3. Add tomatoes and sauté for 3 minutes, return chicken to pot and add chicken stock. Bring to the boil and simmer for 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.4. Remove cooked chicken, let cool enough to handle and shred meat off the bone into bite-size pieces. Place meat back into soup along with rice. Cook for 15 minutes longer or until rice is tender.5. Add more water or stock if necessary to loosen soup to desired consistency.6. Just before serving stir in peas and spinach.7. Heat through, season with salt and pepper and serve with a dollop of sour cream.
